intro: Tradescantia albida, commonly known as the silver sword or white spiderwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It features rosettes of fleshy, silver-green leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Tradescantia albida is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate a variety of growing conditions.
